test_scenarios.description: AutoTech Systems is an automotive OEM developing autonomous vehicles. We use MATLAB/Simulink for modeling, DOORS for requirements management, and follow ISO 26262 for functional safety. Our main challenges include complex sensor integration and safety certification for self-driving features.
MedDevice Innovations develops cardiac monitoring medical devices. We follow FDA regulations and IEC 62304 standards. Our main challenges are clinical validation and regulatory approval processes.

AutoTech Systems.objective: At the end of 2 weeks, participants will be able to identify and analyze system boundaries, interfaces, and emergent properties in AutoTech Systems's Autonomous Systems architecture by creating system models using DOORS so that Complex system integration challenges are better understood and resolved.

iteration_history.objective: At the end of 4 hours, participants will understand system boundaries in AutoTech Systems's Autonomous Systems projects.
At the end of 1 week, participants will be able to identify system boundaries and interfaces in AutoTech Systems's Autonomous Systems architecture by analyzing system models using DOORS.

At the end of 2 weeks, participants will be able to identify and analyze system boundaries, interfaces, and emergent properties in AutoTech Systems's Autonomous Systems architecture by creating system models using DOORS so that Complex system integration challenges are better understood and resolved.

AutoTech Systems.objective: At the end of 3 weeks, participants will be able to elicit, analyze, and document stakeholder requirements for AutoTech Systems's Autonomous Systems projects by applying Requirements Engineering processes using DOORS so that Complex system integration issues are reduced and project success is improved.

iteration_history.objective: Participants will learn requirements engineering using DOORS.
At the end of 2 weeks, participants will demonstrate requirements elicitation and documentation for AutoTech Systems's Autonomous Systems projects by creating requirement specifications using DOORS.

At the end of 3 weeks, participants will be able to elicit, analyze, and document stakeholder requirements for AutoTech Systems's Autonomous Systems projects by applying Requirements Engineering processes using DOORS so that Complex system integration issues are reduced and project success is improved.

AutoTech Systems.objective: At the end of 4 weeks, participants will be able to apply Technical leadership principles effectively in AutoTech Systems's Automotive environment by implementing V-Model practices so that team performance and project outcomes are enhanced.

iteration_history.objective: Participants will apply Technical leadership in their work at AutoTech Systems.
At the end of 3 weeks, participants will effectively apply Technical leadership principles in AutoTech Systems's Automotive projects by implementing best practices.

At the end of 4 weeks, participants will be able to apply Technical leadership principles effectively in AutoTech Systems's Automotive environment by implementing V-Model practices so that team performance and project outcomes are enhanced.
